alert.note: Alert for Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:55PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Throckmorton County through 1115 PM CDT... At 1054 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Elbert, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 45 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Throckmorton County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
